Replace.Text: Classical era support unit. Can construct Forts, Roads, Airstrip, and Missile Silo improvements.

Infantry units receive +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when in friendly territory.
Religious units receive +1 spread charge.
Units receive +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when in friendly territory.
+3 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities from Research Labs.
Theater districts provide [ICON_Production] Production equal to their adjacency bonus.
Campus and Theater districts provide +1 Influence Point per turn.
Campus districts provide [ICON_Production] Production equal to their adjacency bonus.
+3 [ICON_Gold] Gold, +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities in the Capital.
+10% Growth in all cities. Reduce the cost of purchasing tiles by 20%.
Shrines produce +1 [ICON_Science] Science. +2 [ICON_GreatScientist] Great Scientist points per turn.
Military units receive +20% experience in combat. +2 [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General points per turn.
Double experience and +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for Recon units.
+1 [ICON_Production] Production and +1 [ICON_Housing] Housing in all cities.
Cities with an Aqueduct receive +1 [ICON_Housing] Housing and +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities.
[ICON_GreatWork_Writing] Great Works of Writing produce +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture. +2 [ICON_GreatWriter] Great Writer points per turn.
+6 City [ICON_Strength] Defense Strength. +5 City [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strength. +100% [ICON_Production] Production toward defensive buildings.
Military units heal in neutral and hostile territory as if they were in friendly territory.
+4 City [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strength. +50% [ICON_Production] Production towards Encampment districts and buildings.
Melee and Anti-Cavalry units receive +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement. Yields from pillaging improvements are doubled.
+50% Campus district adjacency bonuses.
Naval units receive +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement. +2 [ICON_GreatAdmiral] Great Admiral points per turn.
+1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities for cities with a garrisoned unit.
+4 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +4 [ICON_Science] Science, +4 [ICON_Production] Production in the [ICON_Capital] Capital.
+50% Theater Square adjacency bonuses.
+50% Industrial Zone adjacency bonuses.
+2 [ICON_Housing] Housing in all cities with a least 2 specialty districts. +4 City [ICON_Strength] Defense Strength.
+50% Commercial Hub adjacency bonuses.
+1 [ICON_Movement] Movement when starting turn in friendly territory.
+2 [ICON_Gold] Gold from [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes. +2 [ICON_GreatMerchant] Great Merchant points per turn.
Workshops produce +2 [ICON_Science] Science. +2 [ICON_GreatEngineer] Great Engineer points per turn.
Great Works of Art [ICON_GreatWork_Portrait][ICON_GreatWork_Religious][ICON_GreatWork_Landscape] produce +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture. +2 [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist points per turn.
+15% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism to civilizations to which you have a [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route.
Settler cost reduced by 60%. Plot purchase cost reduced by 30%.
Military units receive +20% experience in combat. +4 [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General points per turn.
Military Academies and Seaports generate +5% City [ICON_Science] Science each.
Great Works of Music [ICON_GreatWork_Music] produce +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture. +4 [ICON_GreatMusician] Great Musician points per turn.
Accumulate 25% less war weariness than usual. Yields from pillaging are doubled.
+50% Commercial Hub adjacency bonuses and +100% Harbor adjacency bonuses.
+50% Campus and Industrial Zone adjacency bonuses.
+4 [ICON_Gold] Gold from [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes. +4 [ICON_GreatMerchant] Great Merchant Points per turn.
+1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities for cities with a garrisoned unit. Accumulate 25% less War Weariness than usual.
+4 [ICON_Housing] Housing, +2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities, -6 [ICON_Gold] Gold to all cities with at least 3 specialty districts.
Research Labs produce +10% City [ICON_Science] Science. +4 [ICON_GreatScientist] Great Scientist points per turn.
Accumulate 40% less war weariness than usual.
+50% Theater Square adjacency bonuses, and Stadiums generate +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities.
+50% [ICON_Production] Production toward Information era air units, and toward all Carriers.
Receive 1 free copy of each Strategic Resource other than Uranium.

Allows Builders to embark.
+1 [ICON_Gold] Gold from the Fishing Boat improvement.
All [ICON_Tourism] Tourism yields are doubled.
+1 [ICON_Movement] Movement for all naval units.
+1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from the Mine improvement.
+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food from the Plantation improvement.
+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production from the Quarry improvement.
Allows Scouts to embark.
Allows all land units to embark, and allows harvesting of [ICON_RESOURCE_FISH] Fish.
Grants the ability to construct an additional Spy.
All naval and embarked units can navigate Ocean tiles. +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement for embarked units.
+1 [ICON_FOOD] from the Plantation improvement.
Kill a Quadrireme unit.
Discovering new lands has inspired your people build ships to colonize them.
Build 2 Harbors.
Constructing Harbors gives you the infrastructure to finance voyages of exploration.
Build 2 Libraries.
Philosophers peruse your libraries to build on the knowledge of their predecessors.
Build 2 Military Engineers
Your Military Engineers have given you valuable practical knowledge in metalworking.
Reach level 3 with a Naval unit.
Your experienced ship captains have charted new seas with the latest technology.
Have the Medieval Faires civic.
Your faires have triggered competition amongst your craftsmen to create ever more wondrous mechanisms.
Earn a Great Engineer.
The practices of your Great Engineer have launched a wave of innovation throughout your people.
Build a Printer.
New scientific journals are encouraging specialized research and training.
Build a Foundry.
Advances in industrial efficiency provide lucrative opportunities to exploit mineral resources.
Own 2 Quadriremes.
Further advances in shipbuilding inspire your people to new innovations.
Build a Gristmill.
Industrializing food production has encouraged your people to develop better methods of transport.
Own 3 Infantry.
Military exercises have led to the development of new battlefield weapons and tactics.
Own 3 Field Cannon.
The push to improve weapon ranges has led to advances in the understanding of Physics.
Research the Irrigation technology.
Your people have learned advanced cultivation techniques, allowing a large population which must be governed by laws.
Build 2 Holy Sites.
Your people are gathering to seek the wisdom of the gods.
Kill 1 Barbarian.
Members of your tribe have gathered together to protect your people.
Found 2 cities.
Your people have encountered new gods as they settle the wilderness.
Build 2 Shrines.
Your people have started to develop a musical tradition to better praise the gods.
Build 3 Monuments.
You have erected Monuments in your cities to establish a common law throughout the land.
Own 2 Missionaries.
The flowering of your religion has led to an evolution of its beliefs.
Build 2 Agora.
Your government's reach is expanding through the cultivation of educated bureaucrats.
Research the Castles technology.
The development of Castles has led to a revolution in battlefield logistics.
Build 2 Amphitheaters.
Your civilization's wealthy classes have started to commission cultural works, leading to a renaissance.
Build a Guild Hall.
Cultural societies have been founded in order to encourage the arts.
Build an Observatory.
Advances in ocular lenses have led to a greater understanding of Perspective.
Grow your civilization to at least 50 population.
A large population allows your civilization to levy and support a substantial military force.
Pillage a tile.
Your military has found that pillaging enemy resources provides much-needed supplies and booty.
Build an Opera House.
The widening gulf between the wealthy and the poor has furthered the development of radical political philosophies.
Earn 9 Great People.
Charismatic and passionate leaders are pushing for greater freedom and providing voices to the downtrodden.
Research The Internet technology.
The widespread adoption of the Internet has led to the creation of virtual worlds, where people can escape their ordinary existence.
Research the Guidance Systems technology.
The creation of advanced weaponry has left those without it with little choice but to develop new tactics to fight advanced opponents.
"Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach a man how to fish and you feed him for a lifetime."[NEWLINE]- Lao Tzu
"One doesn't discover new lands without losing sight of the shore."[NEWLINE]- Andre Gide
"There is only one good, knowledge, and one evil, ignorance."[NEWLINE]- Socrates
"Magnetism, as you recall from physics class, is a powerful force that causes certain items to be attracted to refrigerators."[NEWLINE]- Dave Berry
"And them that take the sword shall perish by the sword."[NEWLINE]- The Bible, Matthew
“To invent, you need a good imagination and a pile of junk.”[NEWLINE]- Thomas Edison
"God is a meticulous clockmaker. So precise is His order that everything on earth happens in its own time."[NEWLINE]- Elif Shafak
"If in other sciences we should arrive at certainty without doubt and truth without error, it behooves us to place the foundations of knowledge in mathematics."[NEWLINE]- Roger Bacon
"I fooled you, I fooled you, I got pig iron, I got pig iron, I got all pig iron."[NEWLINE]- Lonnie Donegan
"The introduction of so powerful an agent as steam to a carriage on wheels will make a great change in the situation of man."[NEWLINE]- Thomas Jefferson
"Measure what is measurable, and make measurable what is not so."[NEWLINE]- Galileo
"I would rather be the hammer than the anvil."[NEWLINE]- Erwin Rommel
"There's a basic principle about consumer electronics: it gets more powerful all the time and it gets cheaper all the time."[NEWLINE]- Trip Hawkins
"The unleashed power of the atom has changed everything save our modes of thinking, and we thus drift toward unparalleled catastrophes."[NEWLINE]- Albert Einstein
"Now, somehow, in some new way, the sky seemed almost alien."[NEWLINE]- Lyndon B. Johnson
"We are all now connected by the Internet, like neurons in a giant brain."[NEWLINE]- Stephen Hawking
"A tribe is a group of people connected to one another, connected to a leader, and connected to an idea."[NEWLINE]- Seth Godin
"It has been well said that mythology is the penultimate truth - penultimate because the ultimate cannot be put into words."[NEWLINE]- Joseph Campbell
"Victorious warriors win first and then go to war, while defeated warriors go to war first and then seek to win."[NEWLINE]- Sun Tzu
"Not at all similar are the race of the immortal gods and the race of men who walk upon the earth."[NEWLINE]- Homer
"If music be the food of love, play on."[NEWLINE]- William Shakespeare
“The first requirement of a sound body of law is, that it should correspond with the actual feelings and demands of the community, whether right or wrong.”[NEWLINE]- Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.
"Three things are necessary for the salvation of man: to know what he ought to believe; to know what he ought to desire; and to know what he ought to do."[NEWLINE]- St. Thomas Aquinas
"The bureaucracy is expanding to meet the needs of the expanding bureaucracy."[NEWLINE]- Unknown
"The battle is fought and decided by the quartermasters, long before the shooting begins."[NEWLINE]- Erwin Rommel
“Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up.”[NEWLINE]- Pablo Picasso
"Art for art's sake is an empty phrase. Art for the sake of truth, art for the sake of the good and the beautiful, that is the faith I am searching for."[NEWLINE]- George Sand
“The trick to forgetting the big picture is to look at everything close up.”[NEWLINE]- Chuck Palahniuk
"A man does not have himself killed for a half-pence a day or for a petty distinction. You must speak to the soul in order to electrify him."[NEWLINE]- Napoleon Bonaparte
“Without Revolutionary theory, there can be no Revolutionary Movement.”[NEWLINE]- Vladimir Ilyich Lenin
"Social progress can be measured by the social position of the female sex."[NEWLINE]- Karl Marx
"When virtual reality gets cheaper than dating, society is doomed."[NEWLINE]- Scott Adams
"The strong do what they will, the weak do what they must."[NEWLINE]- Thucydides
“A map of the world that does not include Utopia is not worth even glancing at....Progress is the realisation of Utopias.”[NEWLINE]- Oscar Wilde

+10% city growth. +1 [ICON_Food] from Forest tiles.
+10% city growth. +1 [ICON_Food] from Sea tiles.
Raises the strength of your outer defenses. +2 [ICON_Production] when building Units.
+15% [ICON_Faith] Faith in this city. Cannot be built in the same city as the Reliquary.
+5 [ICON_Production] Production when constructing Buildings and Districts.
+3 [ICON_Production] Production when constructing Buildings and Districts.
+1 [ICON_Gold] Gold from city international [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes per bonus resource owned by city. Cannot be built in the same city as the Guild Hall.
+1 [ICON_Gold] Gold from Mine and Quarry improvements. Cannot be built in the same city as the Gristmill.
Provides [ICON_Food] Food equal to the Industrial Zone's [ICON_Production] Production adjacency bonus. Cannot be built in the same city as the Foundry.
+1 [ICON_Food] Food from Farm improvements.
+1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_Production] Production from Plantation improvements. Cannot be built in the same city as the Caravansary.
+20% city growth.
+2 [ICON_Production] Production when constructing Buildings and Districts.
Raises the strength of your outer defenses. +4 [ICON_Production] when building Units.
Provides the Campus with an additional standard adjacency bonus from Mountains. Cannot be built in the same city as the Printer.
+{1_num} [ICON_Science] Science from the adjacent Mountains {1_Num : plural 1?tile; other?tiles;}.
Bonus is extended to all cities within 6 tiles.
+2 [ICON_Science] Science from [ICON_GreatWork_Writing] Great Works of Writing in this city. Cannot be built in the same city as the Observatory.
+2 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture from [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relics in this city. Cannot be built in the same city as the Basilica.
+1 [ICON_Food] Food from Farm improvements.
Raises the strength of your outer defenses.

A building unique to Japan. +4 [ICON_Production] Production to all cities within 6 tiles. After researching the Electronics technology this building provides an additional +4 [ICON_Culture] Culture to its city.
Holy Sites
Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to any city-state provide +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for every specialty district in the origin city.
Your districts on or next to Coast tiles provide +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture.
